required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Sitaxsentan Efficacy And Safety Trial With A Randomized Prospective Assessment Of Adding Sildenafil (SR-PAAS)
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3, Multi-Center, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Safety And Efficacy Study Of Sitaxsentan Sodium In Subjects With Pulmonary Arterial Hypertension

brief_summary.textblock: This protocol is for subjects with pulmonary arterial hypertension and is the first of 3 studies forming the Sitaxsentan efficacy and safety trial with Randomized Prospective Assessment of Adding Sildenafil (SR-PAAS) program.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Safety Issue: The trial was prematurely terminated on Dec 9, 2010, due to safety concerns, specifically new emerging evidence of hepatic injury.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Total Distance Walked During 6 Minute Walk Distance (6MWD) at Week 12
primary_outcome.description: 6 MWD was the distance that a participant could walk in 6 minutes. Participants were asked to perform the test at a pace that was comfortable to them, with as many breaks as they needed. Continuous pulse oximetry was conducted during the test for safety. Change is Week 12 results minus baseline results.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Change From Baseline in World Health Organization (WHO) Functional Classification at Weeks 4, 8 and 12
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Weeks 4, 8 and 12 or Early Termination (ET)
secondary_outcome.description: WHO functional classification for PAH ranges from Class I (no limitation in physical activity, no dyspnea with normal activity) to Class IV (cannot perform a physical activity without any symptoms, dyspnea at rest). Improvement = reduction in functional class, deterioration = increase in functional class, no change = no change in functional class.

TTCW defined as the number of days between first dose of study drug and the occurrence of a predefined clinical worsening event. Predefined clinical worsening events included: hospitalization for worsening PAH, on-study death, heart-lung or lung transplant, atrial septostomy or withdrawal due to the addition of any chronic medications for the treatment of worsening PAH.

intervention.description: Sitaxsentan = 100 mg tablet administered orally, once daily
Sitaxsentan Placebo = 1 tablet administered orally, once daily

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Current diagnosis of symptomatic pulmonary arterial hypertension (PAH) classified by one of the following: idiopathic arterial hypertension (IPAH), primary pulmonary hypertension (PPH), familial pulmonary arterial hypertension (FPAH) or pulmonary arterial hypertension (PAH) associated with connective tissue diseases. Has WHO functional class III symptoms.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous exposure to an endothelin receptor antagonist (ETRA) such as sitaxsentan, bosentan or ambrisentan.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Matching placebo tablet once a day

class.title: greater than or equal to 65 years

measure.title: World Health Organization (WHO) Functional Class
measure.description: WHO Pulmonary Arterial Hypertension (PAH) Functional Classification: I (no limitation on physical activity), II (slight limitation on ordinary physical activity), III (marked limitations on physical activity comfortable at rest) and IV (unable to carry out any physical activity without symptoms, dyspnea and fatigue present at rest).

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Total Distance Walked During 6 Minute Walk Distance (6MWD) at Week 12
outcome.description: 6 MWD was the distance that a participant could walk in 6 minutes. Participants were asked to perform the test at a pace that was comfortable to them, with as many breaks as they needed. Continuous pulse oximetry was conducted during the test for safety. Change is Week 12 results minus baseline results.
outcome.population: Intent to treat population (ITT): all participants who were randomized; missing value at Week 12 imputed with last non-missing value, including the non-missing value obtained at early termination based on last observation carried forward (LOCF)

group.title: Sitaxsentan
group.description: Sitaxsentan 100 milligrams (mg) tablet orally once a day

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Matching placebo tablet once a day

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Total Distance Walked During 6 Minute Walk Distance (6MWD) at Week 12
measure.description: 6 MWD was the distance that a participant could walk in 6 minutes. Participants were asked to perform the test at a pace that was comfortable to them, with as many breaks as they needed. Continuous pulse oximetry was conducted during the test for safety. Change is Week 12 results minus baseline results.
measure.population: Intent to treat population (ITT): all participants who were randomized; missing value at Week 12 imputed with last non-missing value, including the non-missing value obtained at early termination based on last observation carried forward (LOCF)

analysis.p_value_desc: Significance test performed using non-parametric analysis of covariance controlling for Baseline 6MWD and PAH etiology and PAH not secondary to a connective tissue disease (other).
analysis.estimate_desc: Missing value at Week 12 assigned as zero if the subject had a predefined clinical worsening event, otherwise, missing value at Week 12 imputed with the last non-missing 6MWD based on LOCF.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Change From Baseline in World Health Organization (WHO) Functional Classification at Weeks 4, 8 and 12
outcome.description: WHO functional classification for PAH ranges from Class I (no limitation in physical activity, no dyspnea with normal activity) to Class IV (cannot perform a physical activity without any symptoms, dyspnea at rest). Improvement = reduction in functional class, deterioration = increase in functional class, no change = no change in functional class.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Weeks 4, 8 and 12 or Early Termination (ET)
outcome.population: ITT; N=number of participants with analyzable data; n=number of participants with analyzable data at the specific time point

group.title: Sitaxsentan
group.description: Sitaxsentan 100 milligrams (mg) tablet orally once a day

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Matching placebo tablet once a day

measure.title: Number of Participants With Change From Baseline in World Health Organization (WHO) Functional Classification at Weeks 4, 8 and 12
measure.description: WHO functional classification for PAH ranges from Class I (no limitation in physical activity, no dyspnea with normal activity) to Class IV (cannot perform a physical activity without any symptoms, dyspnea at rest). Improvement = reduction in functional class, deterioration = increase in functional class, no change = no change in functional class.
measure.population: ITT; N=number of participants with analyzable data; n=number of participants with analyzable data at the specific time point

analysis.p_value_desc: Significance tests of WHO Functional Class performed using the Cochran-Mantel-Haenszel (CMH) test, stratified by Baseline 6MWD (less than 310 meters and greater than or equal to 310 meters) and PAH Etiology (Connective Tissue Disease and others).
analysis.method_desc: The CMH test used modified ridit scores, and the p-value corresponding to ANCOVA (row mean scores) statistics were used.

outcome.title: Time to Clinical Worsening (TTCW)
outcome.description: TTCW defined as the number of days between first dose of study drug and the occurrence of a predefined clinical worsening event. Predefined clinical worsening events included: hospitalization for worsening PAH, on-study death, heart-lung or lung transplant, atrial septostomy or withdrawal due to the addition of any chronic medications for the treatment of worsening PAH.
outcome.population: ITT; N=number of participants with analyzable data

group.title: Sitaxsentan
group.description: Sitaxsentan 100 milligrams (mg) tablet orally once a day

group.title: Placebo

measure.title: Time to Clinical Worsening (TTCW)
measure.description: TTCW defined as the number of days between first dose of study drug and the occurrence of a predefined clinical worsening event. Predefined clinical worsening events included: hospitalization for worsening PAH, on-study death, heart-lung or lung transplant, atrial septostomy or withdrawal due to the addition of any chronic medications for the treatment of worsening PAH.
measure.population: ITT; N=number of participants with analyzable data

measurement_list.measurement: Not Applicable (NA). TTCW not calculated unless at least 50 percent of participants in each treatment group had a clinical worsening event.
TTCW not calculated unless at least 50 percent of participants in each treatment group had a clinical worsening event.

reported_events.desc: The same event may appear as both an adverse event (AE) and a serious adverse event (SAE). However, what is presented are distinct events. An event may be categorized as serious in one participant and as nonserious in another participant, or one participant may have experienced both a serious and nonserious event during the study.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
